title: PHPfloatval()Function

metadata.description: Learn about PHPfloatval()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example Return the float value of different variables: "; $b = "1234.56789Hello"; echo floatval($b) . "
"; $c = "Hello1234.56789"; echo floatval($c) . "
"; ?> Definition and Usage The floatval() function returns the float value of a variable. Syntax floatval( variable ); Parameter Values Parameter Description variable Required. Specifies the variable to check. Must be a scalar type Technical Details Return Value: The float value of the variable on success, 0 on failure. An empty array will return 0, and a non-empty array will return 1 Return Type: Float PHP Version: 4.2+ ★ +1

content_sections.title: Example
content_sections.code:
"; $b = "1234.56789Hello"; echo floatval($b) . "
"; $c = "Hello1234.56789"; echo floatval($c) . "
"; ?>

summary: This tutorial covers PHPfloatval()Function concepts and techniques.
